dcterms:creator: I. Szita
C. Szepesvári
dcterms:description: Stochastic SZ-Tetris is a benchmark for reinforcement learning that preserves the core challenges of standard Tetris but allows faster evaluation of different strategies due to shorter episodes by removing easier tetrominoes. It is played on a board of standard Tetris size with a width of 10 and a height of 20, where either an S-shaped or Z-shaped tetromino appears with equal probability.
dcterms:title: Stochastic SZ-Tetris

dcterms:creator: I. Szita
C. Szepesvári
dcterms:description: 10×10 Tetris is a smaller version of the standard Tetris game played on a 10×10 board. It uses the standard seven tetrominoes and allows for a maximum score of +4 points for completed rows, with a more complex learning task compared to stochastic SZ-Tetris.
dcterms:title: 10×10 Tetris

dcterms:creator: M. G. Bellemare
Y. Naddaf
J. Veness
M. Bowling
dcterms:description: The Atari 2600 games serve as a platform for evaluating general agents in reinforcement learning. The Arcade Learning Environment provides a standardized interface for these games, allowing for the assessment of various learning algorithms.
dcterms:title: Atari 2600 games
